channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Save the world then go get piste -- Mid-level Perl developer and ski-master in Sevenoaks, Kent
item.description: Youâ€™ll be working with a Modern Perl stack deployed to AWS on Mojolicious with a strong focus on testing and continuous integration, and the infinite wisdom of one of CPANâ€™s most prolific (and nicest) contributors at hand

item.title: Junior Perl developer needed to help a charity and giving-focused team in Kent, UK
item.description: Two of my favourite colleagues from one of my favourite jobs as a developer work there, and are trying to hire people who will reinforce their company culture

item.title: Junior Perl developer needed to help a charity and giving-focused team in Kent, UK
item.description: This might be a unique chance to get trained by awesome developers in a wonderful working environment while adding your contribution to the world being a better place!

item.title: London Perl Workshop 2018
item.description: Saturday 3rd November 2018 London

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop
item.description: September 7-8, 2018 Bern.

item.title: Nordic Perl Workshop and MojoConf 2018
item.description: September 6-7, 2018, Oslo.

item.title: The Perl Conference in Europe
item.description: August 15-17, 2018, Glasgow. The Call for Papers is open.

item.title: How To Lead When You Have No Authority
item.description: An excellent article I saw in the latest edition of the Software Lead Weekly.

item.title: R&D at Graduway
item.description: A new episode of the R&D at $company series. Graduway is a small company that provides SaaS products aimed at universities, schools, enterprises, and other organizations.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Perl6 Readline update
item.description: DrForr short and easy update of Perl6 Readline.

item.title: 2018.28 Ð’Ð²ÐµÐ´ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ Ð² Perl 6
item.description: The weekly awesome.

item.title: Single Page Application with Perl Dancer
item.description: A new edition of the Dancer eBook was published.

item.title: Accessor with type constraint
item.description: An older screencast about accessors with Moose.

item.title: Dancer2::Plugin::Showterm
item.description: One more gem from the bags of Yanick Champoux, that can help Dancer2 app replay terminal typescript captures.

item.title: Machine learning in Perl
item.description: Sergey Kolychev, explains Machine learning in Perl series blog, focusing on the AI::MXNet, a Perl interface to Apache MXNet, a modern and powerful machine learing library.

item.title: Call for Perl Conference North America Photos
item.description: Dawn Wallis requesting on behalf of The Perl Conference for help. If you have any pictures taken as past Perl Conferences (North America) from 1999 to 2018 then please share it with the organizers.

item.title: Moose Never Stops Testing
item.description: Its new test day again in the Moose-Pen by @byterock.

item.title: Why I won't be speaking at OSCON?
item.description: Bryan Hughes pointed out some problematic language slipped into OSCONâ€™s Code of Conduct that added â€œpolitical affiliationâ€ as a protected class. He explains why it is problematic?

item.title: Upgrade from object-oriented to functional programming
item.description: Wojciech Bazant explains his approach moving from object-oriented to functional programmings.

item.title: Becoming a Senior Developer
item.description: Andy Lester, in this blog, guides us through becoming a Senior Developer.

item.title: Undershoot: Parsing theory in 1965
item.description: Jeffrey Kegler revisits the question "Why, despite all evidence, is parsing considered solved?", this time supplying some more background.

item.title: 10 Common Git Problems
item.description: Michael Kohl taking us through the 10 most common git problems and their fix.

item.title: My First ever talk at The Perl Conference in Glasgow 2018
item.description: I am almost ready with my slides for my talk. If you are coming to the event then please do attend my short talk and say hi.

item.title: Evozon Perl internship
item.description: Samuel announced Evozon Perl internship starting on 9th Jul.

item.title: 10 Rules for Side-Hustle Success
item.description: Jeff Haden explains, Side hustles are extremely popular. An estimated 44 million people in the U.S. have a side hustle; that's over six times the number of workers who hold multiple jobs. The process is easy; it only takes a few hours to set up your own small business.

item.title: Want to think Like a Leader?
item.description: Ilya Pozin explaining the secret of becoming a Leader backed by scientific research.

item.title: Conference coming up? Make your brand memorable with custom stickers from StickerYou
item.description: Create custom vinyl stickers, product labels, badges, patches and more with StickerYou.com to market your brand effectively. Our products are perfect to hand out at events or sell to make extra money. You can print any size, shape and order quantity. Use code PERL10 at checkout for a 10% discount.

item.title: #364 - How to be a successfull leader?
item.description:
Hi there,

As per, Ilya Pozin (Founder, Pluto TV), If you want to be a successful leader, research shows there's a winning approach you can take -- and it may not be what you expect. For detailed insights, please read this.

Quick reminder about London Perl Workshop 2018, as you must be aware the next London Perl Workshop 2018 will be held on Saturday 3rd Nov 2018. You are invited to submit talk proposals. The deadline for submissions is Sunday 16th Oct. Talks can be submitted in one of the three categories e.g. Long (45-60 min), Short (15 min) or Lightning (5 min).

Please do join us and make it bigger than ever Perl event. For more details, please take a look.

Enjoy the summer and have fun reading the newsletter but don't forget to send in your suggestions.
